column4: Does anyone know if there is a program like screen that does vertical splits instead of just horizontal splits?
could someone else try telnetting into port 25 on vmadmin's system?
you can use 'man iptables' to learn more about it.
oh I see. I  worded that in a rather ambiguous manner.
But vmadmin seems to have bigger problems than that. He says that the server install is mostly default, but X is listening on TCP, while most of the safer things (ssh,smtp) are filtered.
ubuntu does not filter by defualt
make sure he has openssh-server installed
that will allow others to ssh into his box
so he should: sudo apt-get install openssh-server
without openssh-server, if I tried: ssh -l <username> <ip> it would timeout or say connection refused.
netstat -lt shows ssh, whereas nmap on my machine shows that it is filtered. But actually it appears he might be running under vmware!? Why didn't he tell me that. Oh well, he's left anyway.
haha. But remember, ssh and ssh server are two diff things :)
Yeah, but it is netstat -lt showing it as listening on *:22.
well the port shouldn't be filtered by default. Either way he's gone :p
